Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Web application development using currently popular open-source/open-standard tools. User-interface, the business layer, database, and deploying to the webserver.

College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: .NET Windows and Web application development. Use of the .NET Framework class library. N-tier architecture. User interface, collections, database connectivity, and deployment.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Concepts and practice of software development for mobile devices. User interface, data persistence, data communication, use of APIs for sound, mapping, GPS, sensors, etc.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A software development project using the skills acquired from Software Development I & II. Working in teams, students develop a software system, simulating an industry experience.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Software development concepts are introduced in the context of hands-on project implementation. SDLC, version control, design with UML, documentation, testing, 2&3-tier architecture.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

CEN4802 - Software Integration, Configur.name: CEN4802 - Software Integration, Configuration, and Testing

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Addresses approaches and issues associated with integration of software subsystems and components into one system to ensure that the subsystems function together.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Professional-level database access from object-oriented systems, including complex SQL queries and stored procedures. Use of object-relational frameworks. Hands-on exercises with current RDBMS software.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A continuation of Software Development I with larger and more complex projects. Enterprise-level applications are covered including distributed and web-based systems using n-tier architecture.
